title: Fell in Love with a Girl
description: “Fell In Love With A Girl” was released as the second single off of  White Blood Cells . The video for this song was one of the first  brickfilms  to get mainstream attention.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Fell in love with a girl
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Jack White mentioned the following statement in a 2007 interview with GQ Magazine, which confirmed his appreciation for red-haired women. Karen ElsonThis personal preference manifested itself in his 8-year marriage to redhead model Karen Elson, whom he maintained a good relationship with even after the divorce was finalized.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I fell in love once and almost completely
She's in love with the world
But sometimes these feelings can be so misleading
She turns and says, "Are you alright?"
I said, "I must be fine 'cause my heart's still beating"
"Come and kiss me by the riverside, yeah"
"Bobby says it's fine, he don't consider it cheating now"
Red hair with a curl
Mello-Roll for the flavor and the eyes for peepin'
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: They sit and eat Mello-Roll Ice cream, bizarre little roll-shaped ice cream cones. They’ve been off the market for decades, so this is our best hint that this song is set when Jack White was very young.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Can't keep away from the girl
These two sides of my brain need to have a meeting
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: The practical left brain and the intuitive, romantic right brain are at war with each other. He knows this relationship is a bad idea but he cannot stop himself; the internal conflict is tearing him apart and he needs to find a way to reconcile his contradictory feelings.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Can't think of anything to do, yeah
My left brain knows that all my love is fleeting
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: In pop psychology, the left brain is typically associated with logic-based analytical thinking, while the right brain is more intuitive. (In real scientific psychology, it’s nonsense based on a misunderstanding of how brain lateralization works).So in the narrator’s case, the left, logical side of his brain “knows” that the relationship is hopeless and it is implied that the right, intuitive/emotional side of the brain doesn’t care and wants to pursue this woman in spite of the danger of imminent heartbreak.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: She's just looking for something new, yeah
Said it once before but it bears repeating now
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: The frustration is neverending, especially because the narrator knows his Girl doesn’t love him… but his impulse to be physical with her always wins out.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Can't think of anything to do, yeah
My left brain knows that all my love is fleeting
She's just looking for something new, well
Said it once before but it bears repeating now
Fell in love with a girl
